headline: American Electric Power Weighs Data Center Boom Against Rising Capital Demands
summary: American Electric Power Company is seeing record growth in contracted large load demand, reaching 56 GW of firm commitments by 2030, largely from data centers and industrial customers. The company is planning $5b to $8b in additional capital spending on top of its existing $72b five year plan, including new transmission projects and a fuel cell facility. AEP has introduced specialized data center tariffs in Ohio to limit cost spillover to other customers while supporting rapid load...
